publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5220 Sandra White: Banks To Force Customers Further Into Debt—That the Parliament expresses concern that, as a result of HBOS proposed changes to overdraft fees, many people could be forced into further debt and poverty; considers the actions of Lloyds Banking Group to be motivated by recent court rulings on overdraft charges and boosting profit rather than simplification of operations at HBOS; believes that, as majority shareholders, the UK Government should, as a matter of urgency, initiate an investigation into the effects of these proposed changes and take appropriate action to ensure that ordinary people are not forced into further debt to boost the profits of these banks.

S3M-5220 Banks To Force Customers Further Into Debt (lodged on 17 November 2009) Rob Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Kenneth Gibson*, Angela Constance*, Robin Harper*, Christina McKelvie*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-5220 Banks To Force Customers Further Into Debt (lodged on 17 November 2009) Gil Paterson*, Bill Wilson*

S3M-5220 Sandra White: Banks to Force Customers Further into Debt—That the Parliament expresses concern that, as a result of HBOS proposed changes to overdraft fees, many people could be forced into further debt and poverty; considers the actions of Lloyds Banking Group to be motivated by recent court rulings on overdraft charges and boosting profit rather than a simplification of operations at HBOS, and believes that, as majority shareholders, the UK Government should, as a matter of urgency, initiate an investigation into the effects of these proposed changes and take appropriate action to ensure that ordinary people are not forced into further debt to boost the profits of these banks. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Kenneth Gibson, Angela Constance, Robin Harper, Christina McKelvie, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson, Bill Wilson, Bill Kidd*
